channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘They’re scared of us now’: how co-investment in a tropical forest saw off loggers
item.description: Low-cost tech and joined-up funding have reduced illegal logging, mining and poaching in the Darién Gap – it’s a success story that could stop defores...

item.title: The Titanic, Sinclair C5 and Brexit: the Museum of Failure is coming to the UK
item.description: Exhibition of design flops should suit British sense of humour, says its founder, but also shows failure is a part of learning Britain has been misman...

item.title: King Charles calls for reconciliation and unity in Christmas message
item.description: Monarch urges people to draw strength from community diversity after a year marked by division and violence King Charles has called for reconciliation...

item.title: End of shareholder revolt register ‘will help UK firms bury pay controversies’
item.description: Fears for transparency and governance after closure of public log meant to curb ‘abuses and excess’ in boardrooms UK-listed companies will be able to ...

item.title: Southern California sees third death from atmospheric river storm drenching region
item.description: Some parts of LA saw more than 11in of rain, with flooding, road closures and debris flows reported across the region A strong rain and wind storm, ca...

item.title: Cold health alert as parts of UK set to freeze on Christmas Day
item.description: Organisers of some Christmas Day and Boxing Day swims have cancelled events due to the weather.

item.title: Robertson was 'the scruffy fat lad who conquered Europe twice'
item.description: Those who know him best look back on the illustrious career of John Robertson, Nottingham Forest's double European Cup winner.

item.title: Two men believed missing as coast search continues
item.description: Emergency services are responding to reports of people in trouble in the water off the Devon coast.

item.title: Waterskiing Santas and giant cuts of meat: Christmas around the world
item.description: From London to Bethlehem, services and festivities to mark the holiday cheer are in full swing.

item.title: King's Christmas message urges communities to pull together in times of uncertainty
item.description: He invokes the wartime spirit in his annual speech, delivered from Westminster Abbey.
